alert.note: Alert for Clark (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 05 at 7:48PM CST until March 05 at 8:30PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM CST FOR HENRY...VAN BUREN...EASTERN JEFFERSON...NORTHWESTERN LEE AND NORTHWESTERN CLARK COUNTIES... At 748 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Wayland to near Cantril, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Wayland, Olds and Coppock around 755 PM CST. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Winfield, Mount Union, Croton, Donnellson, Franklin, Pilot Grove and St. Paul. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CST for southeastern Iowa...and northeastern Missouri. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
